ru.ispras.sedna.driver
Interface SednaStatement

public interface SednaStatement

Provides interface methods for loading documents into the database, executing statements of the database language. and retrieving results that statements produce. SednaStatement instance is created with SednaConnection.createStatement() method

See Also:
SednaConnection.createStatement()

Method Detail

execute

boolean execute(java.io.InputStream in)
                throws DriverException,
                       java.io.IOException
Reads XQuery statement from the input stream and executes it. For example let's XQuery statement 'CREATE COLLECTION 'col1'' is taken from file the '1.xquery': 
     SednaConnection con = DatabaseManager.getConnection("localhost", "x", "SYSTEM", "MANAGER");
     con.begin();
     SednaStatement st1 = con.createStatement();
           FileInputStream f = new FileInputStream("1.xquery");
     boolean call_res = st1.execute(f);
     if(!call_res) System.out.println("Collection has been created");
     con.commit();
     con.close();

Parameters:
in - is InputStream object to read an XQuery statement from
Returns:
true if the XQuery statement produced the result, and the result can be obtained using SednaSerializedResult object. In case of statements that do not produce the result (such as updates or bulk load), this method returns false.
Throws:
DriverException - if some error occurred during the statement execution.
java.io.IOException - if failed to read from the given input stream.
See Also:
SednaSerializedResult

execute

boolean execute(java.lang.String queryText)
                throws DriverException
Executes XQuery statement specified by string. For example: 
     SednaConnection con = DatabaseManager.getConnection("localhost", "db1", "SYSTEM", "MANAGER");
     con.begin();
     SednaStatement st1 = con.createStatement();
     boolean call_res = st1.execute("LOAD 'region.xml' 'region'");
     if (!call_res) System.out.println("Document has been loaded");
     con.commit();
     con.close();

Parameters:
queryText - is an XQuery statement.
Returns:
true if the XQuery statement produced the result, and the result can be obtained using SednaSerializedResult object. In case of statements that do not produce the result (such as updates or bulk load), this method returns false.
Throws:
DriverException - if some error occurred during the statement execution.
See Also:
SednaSerializedResult

execute

boolean execute(java.io.InputStream in,
                ResultType resultType)
                throws DriverException,
                       java.io.IOException
Reads XQuery statement from the input stream, executes it and returns result of the specified type. See execute(InputStream) for example of code.

Parameters:
in - server connected input stream to read an XQuery statement from
resultType - is one of the two possible result formats, either ResultType.XML or ResultType.SXML
Returns:
true if the XQuery statement produced the result, and the result can be obtained using SednaSerializedResult object returned by getSerializedResult() method. In case of statements that do not produce the result (such as updates or bulk load), this method returns false.
Throws:
DriverException - if some error occurred during the statement execution..
java.io.IOException - if failed to read from the given input stream.
See Also:
SednaSerializedResult

execute

boolean execute(java.lang.String queryText,
                ResultType resultType)
                throws DriverException
Executes an XQuery statement and returns result of the provided type. See execute(String) for example of code.

Parameters:
queryText - is an XQuery statement.
resultType - is one of the two possible result formats, either ResultType.XML or ResultType.SXML*
Returns:
true if the XQuery statement produced the result, and the result can be obtained using SednaSerializedResult object returned by getSerializedResult() method. In case of statements that do not produce the result (such as updates or bulk load), this method returns false.
Throws:
DriverException - if some error occurred during the statement execution.
See Also:
SednaSerializedResult

loadDocument

void loadDocument(java.lang.String xmlDoc,
                  java.lang.String docName,
                  java.lang.String colName)
                  throws DriverException,
                         java.io.IOException
Loads XML document into the collection of documents in Sedna database. See loadDocument(InputStream, String, String) for example of code.

Parameters:
xmlDoc - XML document as a string
docName - name of the document in database
colName - name of the existing collection in database the document will be loaded into
Throws:
DriverException - in case of error during bulk load
java.io.IOException - if failed to read from the given input stream.

loadDocument

void loadDocument(java.io.InputStream in,
                  java.lang.String docName,
                  java.lang.String colName)
                  throws DriverException,
                         java.io.IOException
Loads XML document into the collection of documents in Sedna database.

Below is the simple example of how to load XML document from file region.xml into the collection col. 

     SednaConnection con = DatabaseManager.getConnection("localhost", "x", "SYSTEM", "MANAGER");
     con.begin();
     SednaStatement st1 = con.createStatement();
     st1.execute("CREATE COLLECTION 'col'");
     st1.loadDocument((InputStream) new FileInputStream("E:/data/region.xml"), "target", "col");
     System.out.println("Document has been loaded into collection");
     con.close();

Parameters:
in - input stream to read XML document from
docName - name of the document in the database
colName - name of the existing collection in database the document will be loaded into
Throws:
DriverException - in case of error during bulk load
java.io.IOException - if failed to read from the given input stream.

getSerializedResult

SednaSerializedResult getSerializedResult()
This method is used to obtain result data from when the query has been successfully executed with one of the execute methods of the SednaStatement interface implementation instance. For example: 
      SednaConnection con = DatabaseManager.getConnection("localhost", "x", "SYSTEM", "MANAGER");
      con.begin();
      SednaStatement st1 = con.createStatement();

      // Execute XQuery query.
      boolean res = st1.execute("doc('region')/regions/*");

      if (res) {
          System.out.println("Result:");
          SednaSerializedResult pr1 = st1.getSerializedResult();
          item  = pr1.next();
          while (item != null) {
              System.out.println(item);
              System.out.println("=====================================\n");
              item = pr1.next();
          }
      }
      con.close();

Returns:
SednaSerializedResult object that can be used to obtain result by items.
See Also:
SednaSerializedResult
